snippet: A new report tracking terrorist attacks around the world said the Nigerian militant group was responsible for nearly 600 more deaths last year than the Islamic State.
abstract: Institute of Economics & Peace issues report tracking global terrorist attacks that shows Nigerian militant group Boko Haram to be responsible for 6,664 deaths in 2014, making it world’s deadliest terror organization.

byline.original: By DIONNE SEARCEY and MARC SANTORA
byline.contributor: Dionne Searcey reported from Dakar, and Marc Santora from New York. Kabiru Anwar contributed reporting from Yola, Nigeria.

lead_paragraph: A new report tracking terrorist attacks around the world said the Nigerian militant group was responsible for nearly 600 more deaths last year than the Islamic State.

headline.main: Boko Haram Ranked Ahead of ISIS for Deadliest Terror Group
headline.print_headline: Boko Haram Tops ISIS in Ranking Terror Groups

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
